channel.title: The Roscoe Blog
channel.description: Official company blog for Roscoe Labs, including developer updates, product news, and other information.

item.title: Why we must encrypt all the news
item.description: The media industry should take Apple's battle with the FBI as a cue to take stronger precautions against a privacy crisis of our own. That starts with wider use of encryption to protect users and sources.

item.title: Bootstrapping Project Spectrum
item.description: Today we're launching a crowdfunding campaign for Project Spectrum, our new effort to promote encrypted publishing of news.

item.title: Additional Benchmark Tests for Beams
item.description: We've done a second round of benchmark tests on our website, running Beams, to see how the framework performs.

item.title: Much Faster Beams
item.description: Beams v0.2.5, our latest update, ratchets up its server performance to go with the same default HTTPS support as before. It's truly the best of both worlds.

item.title: An HTTPS version of Beams
item.description: Today we're releasing Beams v0.2.0, which we believe represents a major milestone for the framework. With this update, Beams now serves content via the HTTPS protocol, to encrypt data while it's in transit to and from the user.

item.title: Beams v0.1.2 is here
item.description: Today we're pleased to announce the release of Beams v0.1.2, our free framework for building media websites. This beta release contains key improvements in three broad areas -- responsiveness, speed, and testing.

item.title: Bundling Beams
item.description: We're happy to announce that the v0.1.1 update of our Beams framework is now available for download.

item.title: Yes, we'll do HTTPS.
item.description: We're wholeheartedly embracing the NYT's recent challenge to convert all news sites by the end of 2015 to the secure HTTPS protocol for serving information to readers.

item.title: Rebooting Roscoe
item.description: Big changes ahead for Roscoe Labs. We're sunsetting the Roscoe.TV web app, announcing a new flagship product on Monday, April 28, 2014.

item.title: Meet Beams, a better web framework
item.description: Today we're elated to publicly release Beams, a free framework for building content-focused, media-rich websites. This version is just an alpha, but we believe it contains the right seeds to become a powerful, full-fledged solution for publishers of all sizes over time.
